Name: Fundamental Attribution Error
Subtitle: Environment >> Personality
Definition: endency for people to under-emphasize situational and environmental explanations for an individual's observed behavior while over-emphasizing dispositional and personality-based explanations.

Name: Anchoring Bias
Subtitle: Our choices aren't really ours
Definition: a cognitive bias whereby an individual's decisions are influenced by a particular reference point or 'anchor'.[1] Once the value of the anchor is set, subsequent arguments, estimates, etc. made by an individual may change from what they would have otherwise been without the anchor.

Name: Confirmation Bias
Subtitle: We dont care what is actually true, we care about making our own truths
Definition: tendency to search for, interpret, favor, and recall information in a way that confirms or supports one's prior beliefs or values.

Name: Availability Heuristic
Subtitle: What comes to our mind first, wins
Definition: a mental shortcut that relies on immediate examples that come to a given person's mind when evaluating a specific topic, concept, method or decision.

Name: Egocentric Bias
Subtitle: It's all about me!
Definition: the tendency to rely too heavily on one's own perspective and/or have a higher opinion of oneself than reality.[1] It appears to be the result of the psychological need to satisfy one's ego and to be advantageous for memory consolidation.
